001package org.biopax.paxtools.controller;
002
003import org.biopax.paxtools.model.BioPAXElement;
004import org.biopax.paxtools.model.Model;
005import org.biopax.paxtools.util.Filter;
006import org.slf4j.Logger;
007import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
008
009import java.util.HashSet;
010import java.util.Set;
011
012/**
013 * This is a utility class for traversing over the dependent objects of a biopax element, based on
014 * property editors
015 */
016public class Traverser
017{
018// ------------------------------ FIELDS ------------------------------
019
020        protected final EditorMap editorMap;
021
022        protected Visitor visitor;
023
024        protected Filter<PropertyEditor>[] filters;
025
026        private final static Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(Traverser.class);
027
028
029// --------------------------- CONSTRUCTORS ---------------------------
030
031        /**
032         * The full constructor.
033         * @param editorMap is used for looking up properties to traverse
034         * @param visitor is a visitor element that determines the action on reaching a biopax element during traversal
035         * @param filters limits the type of properties that are traversed.
036         */
037        public Traverser(EditorMap editorMap, Visitor visitor, Filter<PropertyEditor>... filters)
038        {
039                this.editorMap = editorMap;
040                this.visitor = visitor;
041                this.filters = filters;
042        }
043
044// -------------------------- SETTERS/GETTERS ------------------------
045
046
047        public void setVisitor(Visitor visitor)
048        {
049                this.visitor = visitor;
050        }
051
052        public Visitor getVisitor()
053        {
054                return visitor;
055        }
056
057// -------------------------- OTHER METHODS --------------------------
058
059        /**
060         * Traverse and visit {@link Visitor} all properties of the element.
061         * This method does not traverse iteratively to the values.
062         * @param element BioPAX element to be traversed
063         * @param model to be traversed, but not necessarily (depends on the Visitor implementation).
064         * @param <D> actual BioPAX type which properties and inherited properties will be used
065         */
066        public <D extends BioPAXElement> void traverse(D element, Model model)
067        {
068                Set<PropertyEditor> editors = editorMap.getEditorsOf(element);
069
070                if (editors == null)
071                {
072                        log.warn("No editors for : " + element.getModelInterface());
073                        return;
074                }
075                for (PropertyEditor<? super D,?> editor : editors)
076                {
077                        if (filter(editor))
078                        {
079                                Set<?> valueSet = editor.getValueFromBean(element);
080                                if (!valueSet.isEmpty())
081                    traverseElements(element, model, editor, valueSet);
082            }
083                }
084        }
085
086    protected void traverseElements(BioPAXElement element, Model model, PropertyEditor<?,?> editor, Set<?> valueSet)
087    {
088        for (Object value : new HashSet<Object>(valueSet))
089        {
090                visitor.visit(element, value, model, editor);
091        }
092    }
093
094
095    protected boolean filter(PropertyEditor<?, ?> editor)
096        {
097                for (Filter<PropertyEditor> filter : filters)
098                {
099                        if (!filter.filter(editor))
100                        {
101                                return false;
102                        }
103                }
104                return true;
105        }
106}
107
